alert.note: Alert for Fall River County Area; Southern Black Hills (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 19 at 1:36PM MDT until September 19 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT TODAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 314, 315, 316, 317, 321, AND 322... .DISCUSSION...Critical fire wx conditions have developed this afternoon over northeast WY and far western SD where RH is around 10 percent and westerly winds are gusting to around 30 mph. Conditions will improve this evening, but some areas will see poor RH recovery overnight ahead of an approaching cold front. A cold front slides through the area late tonight/early Tuesday with a period of gusty northwest winds behind the front and much cooler temperatures for mid week. The next chance of wetting rain will be Wednesday night into Thursday night. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 314, 315, 316, 317, 321, AND 322... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 314 Northern Campbell, 315 Southern Campbell, 316 Crook County Plains, 317 Weston County Plains, 321 Southern Black Hills and 322 Fall River County Area. * WINDS...West 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 8 percent. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low relative humidity would produce critical fire weather conditions.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Fall River County Area; Southern Black Hills
